data.title: Keaneshaped.co.uk
data.meta_description: Keaneshaped Discography. Lyrics to every Keane song!
data.text:
Discography / Lyrics

Hello! This is my Keane discography, where you can find information about all the releases, as well as lyrics to all the songs. Tabs for many of the songs can also be found on http://keaneshaped.co.uk/tabs

All valuations are to be approximate guides - you may well find that release for far less! Any corrections, comments, suggestions, etc to chris @ keaneshaped.co.uk

Releases

All releases were put on Universal Music labels (Island Records - UK; Interscope - USA) unless otherwise stated.

Search tips

The shorter the phrase, the more results you're likely to get back!

I spell the shortened form of "because" as "cos", not "cuz" or "cause". Vocal adlibs are generally "Ooo".

This searches on a per-line basis, so lyrics spanning multiple lines don't work.

Covers

Performances by Keane (in chronological order)

2003 - Irving Berlin - White Christmas

2004 - Elton John - Your Song

2004 - Walker Brothers - The Sun Ain't Gonna Shine (Anymore)

2004 - U2 - With Or Without You

2005 - Rufus Wainwright - Dinner At Eight

2005 - Louis Armstrong - What A Wonderful World

2005 - Elton John - Goodbye Yellow Brick Road

2006 - Dirrtylicious (Christina Aguilera - Dirrty / Destiny's Child - Bootylicious)

2006 - Depeche Mode - Enjoy The Silence

2007 - The Cult - She Sells Sanctuary

2007 - Genesis - That's All

2007 - Paul Simon - American Tune (only performed once live in New York on 30th May 2007 with no full recordings, so it's not possible to state the lyrics. There are partial versions on YouTube)

2007 - Queen and David Bowie - Under Pressure

2007 - Gwen Stefani - Early Winter

2008 - Another One Bites The Dizzee (Queen - Another One Bites The Dust / Dizzee Rascal - Dance Wiv Me)

2008 - Pulp - Disco 2000

Keane have also acted as backing band during Keane Curate A Night For War Child DVD on:

Brendon Benson & Keane - Cold Hands (Warm Heart) - Tim (Rhodes, backing vocals) and Richard (percussion)

Brendan Benson & Keane - Tiny Spark - Tim (Rhodes, backing vocals) and Richard (percussion)

Lily Allen & Keane - Smile - Tom (acoustic guitar), Tim (Rhodes, backing vocals) and Richard (percussion)

Lily Allen & Keane - Everybody's Changing - Tom (acoustic guitar), Tim (Rhodes) and Richard (percussion)

The band have also mentioned playing some other songs:

"We've been known to play the odd Elton John song, but soundchecks are our only chance to play new songs at the moment. We've played 'Your Song' at a few lunchtime acoustic sets that we occasionally do when we're on tour, and we've recorded a version of Goodbye Yellow Brick Road for an album produced by David Kosten. We also attempted / murdered 'Paperback Writer' at our first few gigs (four part harmony included)." - thebeatsurrender.co.uk - Source

'We're all big fans of Rufus Wrainwright and his songs are great fun to play in soundchecks. We play a lot of Elton John in soundchecks. Things like "Goodbye Yellow Brick Road". We're always playing things that we were into when we started off. Radiohead stuff. My piano has a tremolo switch on and it's the piano they used on "Planet Telex", so we pretend we're Radiohead for a couple of minutes. We like to play Smiths songs. Probably just so Tom can strut up and down the stage pretending to be Morrissey.' - warchildmusic.com - Source

'we used to do a terrible version of a fatboy slim tune whose name escapes me.' [Praise You] - Source

Performances of Keane songs by other artists

Travis - After Mark And Lard Go (based on Somewhere Only We Know)

Natasha Bedingfield - Somewhere Only We Know (performed on Jo Whiley's Radio 1 show on 4th February 2005).

Laura Michelle Kelly - Somewhere Only We Know

Vittorio Grigolo - Bedshaped - lyrics are in Italian.

Lifehouse - Somewhere Only We Know

Pickin' on Keane: A Bluegrass Tribute - a surprisingly good cover of Hopes and Fears

Keane fans from the messageboard have also recorded a cover version of the debut album - "Soaps and Beers". You can download it from http://covers.keane.at - please make a donation to charity!

Lily Allen - Everybody's Changing (originally on Dermot O'Leary's 30th September 2006 Radio 2 show, later recorded and released).

Other songs

The following songs are Keane demos that are floating around the internet. They're different to anything released (featured elsewhere on this site)

Allemande (full band)

Emily

Maps

More Matey

New One

Somewhere Only We Know

The Happy Soldier

To The End Of The Earth (guitar version)

"I'm inclined to think that if people are looking for those tracks then they are probably already interested in the band anyway," says Tom.

"They most likely see those recordings as an interesting extra to get hold of - I don't see it causing any damage. If it was the album we have coming out leaked early then I'd probably feel differently," he adds. Source

The following are unreleased songs (between 1996 and 2006), of which no recordings have been released into the general public. Incidently, it is entirely possible that these songs may be now known under other names and are already released (above).

11th Hour Blues

International releases - Hopes and Fears releases

From what I can work out:

There were no singles in USA, Poland, Norway, Brazil, Japan, Hungary, Russia, Turkey, Italy (despite site contents!)

Keane are not on Universal Records in Hong Kong, Colombia, Finland.

The following have been released:

Country Somewhere Only We Know Everybody's Changing Bedshaped This Is The Last Time Bend And Break Live Recordings 2004 UK Ireland (releases on the preceding Friday) Holland Switzerland Germany Austria France Bundled Canada Australia Spain Czech Republic Norway, Belgium, Italy, Hungary, Poland, Iceland

I'm not 100% sure these are correct/complete - if you have any more information or corrections, PLEASE contact me! (international @ keaneshaped.co.uk)
